fleetmanagementsystem.core.databasemanager module

class fleetmanagementsystem.core.databasemanager.DatabaseManager(db_path: str)[source]

Bases: object

A class for managing database connections and executing queries.

This class provides methods for interacting with a SQLite database, including executing queries and closing the database connection.

close() → None[source]

Close the database connection.

execute_query(query: str, params: Tuple[Any, ...] = (), raise_exceptions: bool = False) → List[Tuple[Any, ...]][source]

Execute a query on the database.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The SQL query to execute.

  • params (Tuple[Any, ...]) – A tuple of parameters to bind to the

  • query.

  • tuple. (Defaults to an empty)

  • raise_exceptions (bool) – Whether to raise exceptions if a

  • False. (database error occurs. Defaults to)

Returns:

The result of the query as a list of tuples. Returns an empty list on error.

Return type:

List[Tuple[Any, …]]

fleetmanagementsystem.core.filtermanager module

class fleetmanagementsystem.core.filtermanager.FilterManager(filters: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Bases: object

A class to manage and apply filters for querying a database.

This class builds SQL WHERE clauses based on user-provided filters and manages resetting the filters to their default states.

apply_filters() → Tuple[str, List[Any]][source]

Build the SQL WHERE clause and corresponding values based on the filters.

Returns:

A tuple containing the SQL query string and the list of query parameters.

Return type:

Tuple[str, List[Any]]

clear_filters() → None[source]

Reset all filters to their default values (to be implemented in subclasses)

handle_invalid_range(field_from: str, field_to: str) → None[source]

Handle invalid range inputs (to be implemented in subclasses).

fleetmanagementsystem.core.vehicle module

class fleetmanagementsystem.core.vehicle.Vehicle(vehicle_type: Literal['Sedan', 'Hatchback', 'SUV', 'Coupe', 'Convertible', 'Minivan', 'Pickup Truck', 'Cargo Van', 'Box Truck', 'Bus', 'Motorcycle', 'Scooter', 'Bicycle', 'Semi-Truck', 'Dump Truck', 'Bulldozer', 'Fire Truck', 'Crane', 'ATV', 'Forklift', 'Snowmobile', 'Speedboat', 'Yacht', 'Ferry', 'Helicopter'], reg_number: str, tax_status: Literal['Paid', 'Unpaid'], tax_type: Literal['Taxed', 'Tax Exempt', 'SORN', 'Untaxed', 'First-Year Rate', 'Reduced Rate', 'Historic', 'Disabled', 'Agricultural Vehicle', 'Exported'], tax_due_date: str | None, service_status: Literal['Done', 'Pending'], service_due_date: str | None, fuel_type: Literal['Diesel', 'Petrol', 'Electricity', 'Hybrid', 'Kerosene', 'Jet Fuel', 'Hydrogen', 'Solar', 'Other'], manufacture_year: int)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a vehicle with various attributes such as type, registration number, tax status, fuel type, and manufacture year.

vehicle_type

The type of the vehicle (e.g., SUV, Sedan).

Type:

str

reg_number

The registration number of the vehicle.

Type:

str

tax_status

The tax status of the vehicle (e.g., Paid, Unpaid).

Type:

str

tax_type

The type of tax applicable to the vehicle.

Type:

str

tax_due_date

The due date for tax payment (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

Type:

Optional[str]

service_status

The service status of the vehicle (e.g., Due, Completed).

Type:

str

service_due_date

The due date for vehicle service (format: YYYY-MM-DD).

Type:

Optional[str]

fuel_type

The type of fuel used by the vehicle (e.g., Petrol, Diesel).

Type:

str

manufacture_year

The year the vehicle was manufactured.

Type:

int

class fleetmanagementsystem.core.vehiclemanager.VehicleManager(db_name: str = 'fleet_management.db')[source]

Bases: object

A manager for handling operations related to vehicles in the database.

conn

SQLite database connection object.

Type:

sqlite3.Connection

add_vehicle(vehicle: Vehicle) → None[source]

Adds a new vehicle to the database.

Parameters:

vehicle (Vehicle) – A Vehicle object containing vehicle details.

Raises:

sqlite3.Error – If there is an error during the insertion process.

create_table() → None[source]

Creates the Vehicles table if it does not already exist.

remove_vehicle(reg_number: str) → None[source]

Removes a vehicle from the database by its registration number.

Parameters:

reg_number (str) – The registration number of the vehicle to remove.

Raises:

sqlite3.Error – If there is an error during the deletion process.

search_vehicles(query: str, params: Tuple[Any, ...] = ()) → List[Tuple[Any, ...]][source]

Searches for vehicles in the database using a custom SQL query.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The SQL query to execute.

  • params (Tuple[Any, ...]) – Parameters to use in the SQL query.

Returns:

Results from the query.

Return type:

List[Tuple[Any, …]]

Raises:

sqlite3.Error – If there is an error during the query execution.

update_vehicle(reg_number: str, **kwargs: Any) → None[source]

Updates details of a specific vehicle in the database.

Parameters:

  • reg_number (str) – The registration number of the vehicle to update.

  • **kwargs – Column-value pairs to update in the database.

Raises:

sqlite3.Error – If there is an error during the update process.
